private_information: Skilled at extracting operator schemas from natural language
Focus on building consistent predicate lists and action models
parser.goal: Produce an accurate JSON description of predicates and operators for the actions paltry, sip, clip, wretched, memory, and tightfisted, without emitting PDDL.

private_information: Specializes in assembling object catalogs, initial states, and goals from scenario statements
Produces clean JSON state specifications for multiple scenarios
state_builder.goal: For each scenario, provide the list of objects, the initial facts, and the goal facts in JSON form, without emitting PDDL.

private_information: Reads plans or drafts candidate plans consistent with the action model and states
Does not produce PDDL, only human-readable or structured plan steps
plan_suggester.goal: For each scenario, provide a plan sketch as a sequence of grounded actions if available; if not available, return an empty or placeholder plan.

private_information: Expert in compiling multi-source specifications into a single coherent PDDL domain and one or more PDDL problem files
Targets the FastDownwards solver; ensures STRIPS-compatible formatting and cleanliness
orchestrator.goal: Integrate the action model and states from all agents to produce the final PDDL domain and the PDDL problem(s) targeting the FastDownwards solver.

public_information: Available actions over objects: paltry object_0 object_1 object_2; sip object_0 object_1 object_2; clip object_0 object_1 object_2; wretched object_0 object_1 object_2 object_3; memory object_0 object_1 object_2; tightfisted object_0 object_1 object_2.

Action paltry(x0,x1,x2) preconditions: hand object_0, cats object_1, texture object_2, vase object_0 object_1, next object_1 object_2. Effects add: next object_0 object_2. Effects delete: vase object_0 object_1.

Action sip(x0,x1,x2) preconditions: hand object_0, cats object_1, texture object_2, next object_0 object_2, next object_1 object_2. Effects add: vase object_0 object_1. Effects delete: next object_0 object_2.

Action clip(x0,x1,x2) preconditions: hand object_0, sneeze object_1, texture object_2, next object_1 object_2, next object_0 object_2. Effects add: vase object_0 object_1. Effects delete: next object_0 object_2.

Action wretched(x0,x1,x2,x3) preconditions: sneeze object_0, texture object_1, texture object_2, stupendous object_3, next object_0 object_1, collect object_1 object_3, collect object_2 object_3. Effects add: next object_0 object_2. Effects delete: next object_0 object_1.
Action memory(x0,x1,x2) preconditions: cats object_0, spring object_1, spring object_2, next object_0 object_1. Effects add: next object_0 object_2. Effects delete: next object_0 object_1.

Action tightfisted(x0,x1,x2) preconditions: hand object_0, sneeze object_1, texture object_2, next object_1 object_2, vase object_0 object_1. Effects add: next object_0 object_2. Effects delete: vase object_0 object_1.

[STATEMENT S1] Initial facts: cats object_0; collect object_10 object_2; collect object_5 object_1; collect object_6 object_1; collect object_7 object_1; collect object_8 object_2; collect object_9 object_2; hand object_11; hand object_12; next object_0 object_8; next object_11 object_6; next object_12 object_10; next object_3 object_7; next object_4 object_10; sneeze object_3; sneeze object_4; spring object_5; spring object_8; stupendous object_1; stupendous object_2; texture object_10; texture object_5; texture object_6; texture object_7; texture object_8; texture object_9. Goal: next object_11 object_7 AND next object_12 object_8.

[PLAN S1] clip object_12 object_4 object_10; wretched object_4 object_10 object_8 object_2; tightfisted object_12 object_4 object_8; wretched object_3 object_7 object_6 object_1; clip object_11 object_3 object_6; wretched object_3 object_6 object_7 object_1; tightfisted object_11 object_3 object_7.

[STATEMENT S2] Initial facts: cats object_0; cats object_1; collect object_10 object_3; collect object_11 object_3; collect object_6 object_2; collect object_7 object_2; collect object_8 object_2; collect object_9 object_3; hand object_12; hand object_13; next object_0 object_9; next object_1 object_9; next object_12 object_11; next object_13 object_7; next object_4 object_8; next object_5 object_11; sneeze object_4; sneeze object_5; spring object_6; spring object_9; stupendous object_2; stupendous object_3; texture object_10; texture object_11; texture object_6; texture object_7; texture object_8; texture object_9. Goal: next object_12 object_10 AND next object_13 object_9.

model.system_prompt: You are an action modeler that extracts a clean operator model and predicate inventory from the public information; do not emit PDDL and instead return a compact JSON object with keys: predicates (list of predicate names with arities), operators (map from action-name to {parameters: [x0,x1,x2,(x3)], preconditions_pos: [predicates], preconditions_neg: [predicates], effects_add: [predicates], effects_del: [predicates]}).
model.prompt: Your name is parser. Read the environment public information to identify all predicates and the six operators paltry, sip, clip, wretched, memory, and tightfisted along with their arguments and semantics. Only output the requested JSON structure using the literal predicate names (hand, cats, sneeze, spring, texture, stupendous, collect, next, vase); do not invent new predicates and do not output PDDL. Source facts: {environment->public_information}.

state_s1.system_prompt: You assemble scenario states; do not emit PDDL; produce JSON with keys: objects (list of all object symbols used), init (list of ground atoms), goal (list of goal atoms).
state_s1.prompt: Your name is state_builder. Build the object list, initial facts, and goals for Scenario S1 using only the first [STATEMENT] block from the public information; do not add or remove facts; produce a JSON object with keys objects, init, and goal. Source: {environment->public_information}.

state_s2.system_prompt: You assemble scenario states; do not emit PDDL; produce JSON with keys: objects (list of all object symbols used), init (list of ground atoms), goal (list of goal atoms).
state_s2.prompt: Your name is state_builder. Build the object list, initial facts, and goals for Scenario S2 using only the second [STATEMENT] block from the public information; do not add or remove facts; produce a JSON object with keys objects, init, and goal. Source: {environment->public_information}.

plan_s1.system_prompt: You summarize or propose a plan; do not emit PDDL; output a plain semicolon-separated list of grounded actions if available, otherwise output an empty list [] or a short note.
plan_s1.prompt: Your name is plan_suggester. For Scenario S1, return the provided plan as a single semicolon-separated line, preserving action names and object order exactly as in the public information. Source: {environment->public_information}.

plan_s2.system_prompt: You summarize or propose a plan; do not emit PDDL; output a plain semicolon-separated list of grounded actions if available, otherwise output an empty list [] or a short note.
plan_s2.prompt: Your name is plan_suggester. For Scenario S2, no plan is provided; return an empty plan [] or a very short candidate sequence only if it strictly follows the preconditions; keep it minimal and human-readable. Source: {environment->public_information}.

compile_pddl.system_prompt: You are an expert with PDDL targeting the FastDownwards solver; integrate the provided operators and states to produce one PDDL domain and two PDDL problems (S1 and S2); ensure STRIPS-compliant operators, consistent predicate declarations, and only use the given symbols; enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> and each problem between <problem id='S1'></problem> and <problem id='S2'></problem>; ensure syntax is compatible with FastDownwards; do not include explanations, only the tagged PDDL artifacts.
compile_pddl.prompt: Use the operator model and the two scenario states to construct a single domain with six actions (paltry, sip, clip, wretched, memory, tightfisted) and two problem instances; ground only the facts listed in each scenario; keep predicate names and object symbols exactly as in inputs; target FastDownwards formatting; inputs: operators={operators_json}; state_s1={state_s1_json}; state_s2={state_s2_json}; optional plans: s1={plan_s1_text}; s2={plan_s2_text}.
